insights.text: The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do. Belief in the impossible is the first step to making it possible.
Start with the customer and work backwards. Everything else—technology, business model, strategy—follows from deeply understanding what they need.
The best investment you can make is in yourself. No one can take away what you've learned, and it compounds forever.
Focus means saying no to a hundred good ideas so you can say yes to the one great one. The discipline of focus is harder than the work itself.
In the long run, your margin is my opportunity. Being willing to accept lower profits today builds an insurmountable advantage tomorrow.
Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing. The more deeply you understand a business, the less risky it becomes.
Design isn't just how something looks—it's how it works. True elegance emerges when form and function become inseparable.
Disagree and commit. Once a decision is made, give it your full energy even if you argued against it. Slow consensus kills companies.
Time is the friend of the wonderful business, the enemy of the mediocre. Patient capital in great companies beats frantic trading every time.
Build products you would want to use yourself. If you're not your own most demanding customer, you'll never understand what excellence really means.
It's always Day 1. The moment you start acting like an established company—protecting what you have instead of inventing what's next—you begin to die.
Someone's sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago. The best decisions pay off decades later.
A-players want to work with A-players. The moment you compromise on talent, you start a downward spiral that's nearly impossible to reverse.
High-velocity decision making beats perfect decisions. Most choices are reversible—make them fast and course-correct as you learn.
It takes twenty years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. Protecting your integrity is more important than any single deal.
Stay hungry, stay foolish. The moment you feel satisfied is the moment you stop pushing boundaries.
Your brand is what people say about you when you're not in the room. Obsess over the customer experience, not the marketing message.
Price is what you pay, value is what you get. The skill is knowing the difference.
Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower. If you're not creating, you're imitating.
If you double the number of experiments you run per year, you'll double your inventiveness. Failure is the tuition you pay for success.
Invert, always invert. Instead of asking how to succeed, ask what would guarantee failure—then avoid those things religiously.
High expectations are the key to everything. If you set the bar low, that's exactly what you'll get.
All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them. The difference between dreamers and achievers is simply action.
The best way to get what you want is to deserve what you want. Deliver value first; rewards follow naturally.
Commit to your business more than anyone else. The only way to beat bigger competitors is to want it more.
The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. Plans without action are just wishes.
Spend each day trying to be a little wiser than when you woke up. Compound wisdom the way others compound money.
Control your expenses better than your competition. Every dollar saved is a dollar you can pass on to customers.
When you believe in something, believe in it all the way—implicitly and unquestionably. Half-commitment produces half-results.
The big money is not in the buying and the selling, but in the waiting. Patience is the ultimate competitive advantage.
Listen to everyone in your company. The best ideas often come from the front lines, not the corner office.
Quality will win out. Make your product so good that people can't help but tell others about it.
Knowing what you don't know is more useful than being brilliant. Intellectual humility is a superpower.
Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore conventional wisdom if it doesn't make sense.
Disneyland will never be completed. It will continue to grow as long as there is imagination left in the world.
If something is important enough, you should try even if the probable outcome is failure. The only true failure is not trying at all.
Our company is always 30 days away from going out of business. That urgency is what keeps us innovating.
Teamwork is the ability to work together toward a common vision. It's the fuel that allows common people to attain uncommon results.
Work like hell. If others are putting in 40-hour weeks and you're putting in 100, even with the same talent, you'll achieve in four months what takes them a year.
The more you suffer, the more you learn. Hard times teach lessons that good times never can.
The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell. Speed of execution matters more than perfection of planning.
First principles thinking: break problems down to their fundamental truths and reason up from there, rather than reasoning by analogy.
Build the chips for the future you believe in, not the market that exists today. Conviction creates markets.
Concentrate your energy and thoughts on the task at hand. Scattered attention produces scattered results.
The factory is the product. Manufacturing innovation is as important as product innovation—maybe more important.
Intellectual honesty is the foundation of great engineering. You can't solve problems you won't admit exist.
Surround yourself with people smarter than you. No one ever made a fortune doing everything themselves.
Constantly think about how you could be doing things better. Keep questioning yourself.
The cowards never started and the weak died along the way. That leaves us. Building something great requires surviving when others quit.
In luxury, you never want to disappoint. Every detail matters because every detail is a promise to the customer.
If you want to build a product people love, you have to love the people who use it. Start by serving them personally before scaling.
Don't tell people how to do things, tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results.
Buy brands that have heritage but need revitalization. The story is already written—you just need to tell it better.
Design for the extremes and the middle will take care of itself. Your most demanding users reveal what everyone really wants.
The trouble in America is not that we're making too many mistakes, but that we're making too few. More attempts mean more breakthroughs.
Creativity needs freedom, but also needs deadlines. Art without commerce is a hobby; commerce without art is just business.
Do things that don't scale. Handcraft your early customer experiences to understand what perfection looks like.
Play by the rules, but be ferocious. You can be ethical and still crush the competition.
Move fast and fix things. Speed isn't just about shipping—it's about learning faster than everyone else.
Pain plus reflection equals progress. Every mistake is a puzzle that, when solved, makes you stronger.
Whether you think you can or think you can't, you're right. Belief precedes capability.
The best companies are built by people who would be building even if they weren't being paid. Genuine obsession can't be faked.
Radical transparency isn't about being nice—it's about being effective. The truth, even when uncomfortable, is the fastest path forward.
Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently. Every setback contains the seed of a comeback.
Make it easy to do business with you. Remove friction at every possible step.
Principles are ways of successfully dealing with reality to get what you want out of life. Without them, you're reacting, not acting.
Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, working together is success. Great companies are built by great teams.
Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great. Good enough is the enemy of excellence.
Turn your wounds into wisdom. Every difficulty you face is teaching you something you need to know.
Don't find fault, find a remedy. Anybody can complain—builders find solutions.
I always tried to turn every disaster into an opportunity. The bigger the crisis, the bigger the chance to pull ahead.
Excellence is the best deterrent to racism, sexism, or any other -ism. Be so good they can't ignore you.
Software is eating the world, but only if someone is hungry enough to build it. The opportunity is there—execution decides who wins.
The ability to deal with people is as purchasable a commodity as sugar or coffee. And I pay more for that ability than for any other.
Create the highest vision possible for your life, because you become what you believe. Small thinking creates small results.
Strong opinions, weakly held. Have conviction in your beliefs, but be willing to change them instantly when presented with better evidence.
Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life. Decide what you want and pursue it relentlessly.
Competition is for losers. The best businesses create categories where they're the only player—monopolies, not competitors.
Only the paranoid survive. Complacency kills companies faster than competition does.
In life, you can blame a lot of people and you can wallow in self-pity, or you can pick yourself up and say, 'Listen, I have to be responsible for myself.'
What valuable company is nobody building? The best opportunities look like bad ideas—that's why others aren't pursuing them.
A strategic inflection point is when the balance of forces shifts from the old structure to a new one. Miss it and you die slowly; see it and you can transform.
Success is not sustainable if it's defined by how big you become. Large-scale success is only possible when you maintain small-company values.
Every moment in business happens only once. The next Bill Gates will not build an operating system. The next Larry Page won't make a search engine.
Bad companies are destroyed by crisis. Good companies survive them. Great companies are improved by them.
The currency of leadership is transparency. You have to be truthful. You cannot hide behind complexity.
We always overestimate the change that will occur in two years and underestimate the change in ten. Don't let yourself be lulled by short-term disappointment.
If you're not doing some things that are crazy, then you're doing the wrong things. Incremental thinking leads to incremental results.
The quality of a leader is reflected in the standards they set for themselves. Set impossible standards, then figure out how to meet them.
Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.
Always work on something uncomfortably exciting. If you're comfortable, you're probably not growing fast enough.
Luck is a dividend of sweat. The more you sweat, the luckier you get.
Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning. Complaints reveal your blind spots.
Lots of companies don't succeed over time. They do the wrong things at the wrong time. They focus on protecting what they have instead of building what's next.
None of us is as good as all of us. Franchisees, suppliers, and the company must all win together.
Success represents the 1% of your work that results from 99% that is called failure. Keep experimenting.
The key to success for Sony is never to follow the others. We must make products that are not currently being made by anyone else.
If you want to be original, you have to accept uncertainty. New ideas are fragile; protect them from premature criticism.
If the government won't let us race, we'll race anyway. Sometimes you have to break the rules that don't make sense.
Curiosity is the key to creativity. The day you lose your curiosity is the day you stop creating.
Getting the team right is the necessary precursor to getting the ideas right. Ideas come from people, so people come first.
The heart and soul of a company is creativity and innovation. Protect the creators and the creations will follow.
Most companies have complex rules to prevent the bottom 3% from causing damage. We fire that 3% and let everyone else operate with freedom.
Quality is the best business plan. Period. Everything else—marketing, distribution, partnerships—amplifies quality or exposes the lack of it.
Take big swings. Don't make small bets. If you're going to bet, bet big on things that matter.
Adequate performance gets a generous severance package. We're a team, not a family—we need stars at every position.
Screw it, let's do it. If somebody offers you an amazing opportunity and you're not sure you can do it, say yes—then learn how to do it later.
Optimism is a kind of pragmatism. If you believe things can get better, you'll look for ways to make them better.
Don't tolerate brilliant jerks. The cost to teamwork is too high.
Train people well enough so they can leave. Treat them well enough so they don't want to.
Time is your most important resource. Use it for things that actually matter—and waste none of it on things that don't.
I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it. There are no shortcuts to success.
Business opportunities are like buses; there's always another one coming. But the best ones don't wait.
Expensive solutions to problems are usually created by people who don't have enough ideas. Constraints breed creativity.
Touch your customer and you're halfway there. Nothing replaces the human connection in selling.
In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different. Sameness is the enemy of significance.
The true IKEA spirit is founded on enthusiasm, renewal, thrift, responsibility, and humility. Fancy offices and titles don't make products better.
If you don't sell, it's not the product that's wrong, it's you. Believe in what you're selling.
Simplicity is the keynote of all true elegance. Strip away the unnecessary until only the essential remains.
I build engines and attach wheels to them. Everything else is secondary to the machine's soul.
I made 5,127 prototypes of my vacuum before I got it right. There were 5,126 failures, but I learned from each one.
Fashion fades, only style remains. Build for permanence, not trends.
The client is not always right. When it comes to the product, the creator knows best.
Enjoy failure and learn from it. You can never learn from success.
If anything is worth doing, it's worth doing to excess. Half-measures accomplish nothing.
Racing is a great mania to which one must sacrifice everything, without reticence, without hesitation.
We're designers and engineers, not marketers. Make something that works better and people will buy it.
The essential part of creativity is not being afraid to fail. Innovation requires the freedom to experiment.
I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work. Each failure is progress.
You have undertaken to ruin me. I won't sue you—the law takes too long. I'll ruin you.
Marketing is what you do when your product is no good. Build something great and it markets itself.
Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration. Ideas without execution are worthless.
Never tell anyone what you're going to do until you've done it. Let results speak.
Go as far as you can see; when you get there, you'll be able to see further. Just take the next step.
Vision without execution is hallucination. Stop dreaming and start building.
Pretend that every single person you meet has a sign around their neck that says 'Make me feel important.'
A man always has two reasons for doing anything: a good reason and the real reason. Understand both.
Don't be intimidated by what you don't know. That can be your greatest strength. Fresh eyes see what experts miss.
A mediocre idea that generates enthusiasm will go further than a great idea that inspires no one.
I would rather hire a man with enthusiasm than a man who knows everything. Attitude trumps aptitude.
My dad used to encourage me to fail. 'What did you fail at this week?' Failure meant I was trying new things.
People fail forward to success. Embrace every failure as a step closer to winning.
Make something people want. Nothing else matters if you don't have that foundation.
Trust your gut. When something feels right but everyone says no, that's often the biggest opportunity.
The art of investing is really the art of having better judgment than other people. Do your homework.
Startups usually win by building something so good that people tell their friends. That's organic growth.
All great companies got there by being aggressive in uncertain markets. Playing it safe is the riskiest strategy.
Target big markets. I'd rather back a great team in a big market than a perfect team in a small one.
Do things that don't scale. Recruit users manually. Give them amazing service. Then figure out how to automate.
The best businesses are ones where the customer wins even more than the company does.
Great companies are built by missionaries, not mercenaries. Passion outlasts profit motive.
I'm not investing in the present. I'm investing in what the world will look like in 30 years.
The learn-it-all will always beat the know-it-all. Curiosity and humility win over arrogance.
We're not in the business of making commodity products. We're here to make the best products, regardless of market share.
In 300 years, people will look back and say this was when humanity changed. Think on that timescale.
Our industry doesn't respect tradition. It only respects innovation. What we did yesterday doesn't matter.
Some people see innovation as change. We see it as making things better. There's a difference.
True simplicity is not the absence of clutter. It's the presence of order. That's much harder to achieve.
Empathy makes you a better innovator. Understanding others' unmet needs reveals opportunities.
Stand for something. If you don't have enemies, you don't have a point of view.
Details aren't details. They make the product. Every element you add or remove changes everything.
In a world that's changing really quickly, the only strategy guaranteed to fail is not taking risks.
Principle fighting is the hardest kind of fighting. When you believe in something, you'll find a way.
We don't have as many managers as we should, but we'd rather have too few than too many. Bureaucracy kills speed.
Move fast and break things. Unless you're breaking stuff, you're not moving fast enough.
With engineering, I view this as doing more with less—making things smaller and more efficient.
Obviously everyone wants to be successful, but I want to be looked back on as being very innovative, and very trusted.
The biggest risk is not taking any risk. In a rapidly changing world, standing still is falling behind.
If everything you try works, you're not trying hard enough. Push into the unknown.
Don't be encumbered by history. Go off and do something wonderful.
Integrity is the most important value. Without it, nothing else matters.
Free beef is the best advertising. Exceed expectations and customers become evangelists.
If you treat employees well, they treat customers well. It's that simple.
The semiconductor business requires patient capital and long-term thinking. Quick profits destroy innovation.
Profit-sharing makes everyone think like an owner. When your team wins, share the winnings.
Don't raise prices just because you can. Low prices build loyalty that lasts decades.
Limit your selection, turn your inventory fast, and keep your costs low. Complexity is the enemy of profits.
Avoid taxes, build scale, leverage relationships. Capital allocation is the whole game.
Control is not leadership; management is not leadership. Leadership is influence and inspiration.
Members are everything. Treat them right and they'll be customers for life.
The deal is more important than the business. Structure determines outcome.
The problem is never how to get new, innovative thoughts into your mind, but how to get the old ones out.
Be quick, be quiet, be on time. Skunk Works succeeds because we eliminate bureaucracy.
On my business card, I am a corporate president. In my mind, I am a game developer. In my heart, I am a gamer.
A delayed game is eventually good, but a rushed game is forever bad. Quality takes time.
The best design is the simplest one that works. Complexity is a tax on every operation.
Above all, video games are meant to just be one thing: fun. Fun for everyone.
What if everything you see is more than what you see? The person next to you is a warrior.
Content is king. Hardware without great software is just expensive furniture.
I couldn't find the sports car of my dreams, so I built it myself. Necessity is the mother of invention.
In the beginning, I looked around and could not find the car I dreamed of. So I decided to build it myself.
We are not in competition with Sony or Microsoft. We are in competition with indifference.
Committees design camels. Great cars are designed by individuals with vision.
If you have a body, you are an athlete. Our purpose is to serve every athlete in the world.
When I started Oracle, I had no money and I had no reputation. What I did have was conviction.
I want to be remembered as someone who pushed the limits of what was possible.
The real purpose of running isn't to win a race. It's to test the limits of the human heart.
The most important aspect of my personality is my curiosity. I'm curious about everything.
Sony is not merely a business. It is a creative institution with a soul.
SpaceX is about pushing boundaries and doing the impossible. That's what gets us up every morning.

Create products that no one else has made. Being first is more important than being best.
Execution matters more than strategy. A good plan violently executed beats a perfect plan every time.
The world is changing very fast. Big will not beat small anymore. It will be the fast beating the slow.
The best founders combine healthy paranoia with relentless optimism. They see both danger and opportunity.
The internet is still young. We're building infrastructure that will last for decades.
Monopoly is a terrible thing, until you have it. Then it's quite nice.

Only buy something you'd be perfectly happy to hold if the market shut down for ten years.
You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. Trust that things will work out.
Work backwards from the customer, not forwards from your capabilities. Customer needs should drive everything.

Missionaries build better products than mercenaries. People who love what they're building always win.
In the business world, the rearview mirror is always clearer than the windshield. Act on conviction, not hindsight.
Take a simple idea and take it seriously. Most people overcomplicate what should be straightforward.
When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
We keep moving forward, opening up new doors and doing new things, because we're curious.
Develop into a lifelong self-learner through voracious reading. Cultivate curiosity across disciplines.
Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.
I always like to look on the optimistic side of life. But I am realistic enough to know life is a complex matter.

I would rather earn 1% off 100 people's efforts than 100% of my own efforts.

The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
